messages.message:
in @Brian’s test project for the AI Hub enablement demo today, he had a derived field that added a new column to a table field

the original table field (“Transactions” in screenshot 2) does not have year in the “Date” column -> however, the derived field added a year in the “Date” column somehow, and the year is incorrect (screenshot 1)

the bank statement in this case is from 2021, but the derived field contains 2023 for every value in the “Date” column - could this come from https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1785 somehow? @jordy.vlan

this isn’t the exact same document that Brian used, but I’ve attached a very similar bank statement below that we can use to reproduce

cc @Nikolaos Kofinas as well since this is related to model performance for derived fields
some more details needed: this was with install? also what was the prompt?
Will update with project link here shortly!
Don’t think it is related to my PR, rather more the absence of it. But need to check with Nikolaos which chains are called under the hood for derived fields.
@Brian i don’t see 2023 in the date column in the tables in this project? did you change the project, or were you using a different project during the demo?

https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/build/019175f0-4284-7e78-b7d6-1d3042365fbc

Oops, sorry, it should be the derived fields project. Linked above :slightly_smiling_face:

btw here are the field schemas, in case you don’t have access to the project @Nikolaos Kofinas

• Transactions
    ◦ Table extraction
    ◦ Extract all transaction tables and append a column for the name of the bank (chase and capitalone)
• Transaction categories
    ◦ Document reasoning
    ◦ What are the transaction and purchase categories? Account for each type of transaction present.
• Categorized Transactions - this is the field with the incorrect year in the dates
    ◦ Derived field
    ◦ Append a column with transaction categories (use *Transaction categories* as a reference guide example) to *Transactions*. Make sure to have a valid transaction category value for each row.
